result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy appeared by video.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial. Case remains in trial posture. Defense requests an adjourned final pretrial date. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services reduced to LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. Defendant is authorized to appear by Zoom on the next court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail, filed.

Defendant's Request to Appear Remotely, filed. 
Forwarded to Judge for review.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference, off the record.  Defense requested final pretrial and jury trial dates.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court, defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy not in court, in custody at Waukeshas County Jail.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Rauch requesting adjournment due to pending revocation hearing in Waukesha. Atty Harris appointed by SPD has never appeared in this matter, Atty Rauch has been fully retained. Court orders Atty Harris Withdrawn.  Case remains calendared in Branch 25. Scheduling Conference scheduled for 7/28/22 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court by video, defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Heard-Handy is in custody in Waukesha, not produced. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court, defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant is in Waukesha County Jail. Due to the unavailability of the defendant, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. State to submit an order to produce for the defendant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 033173,
Payable Number: 998203,
Receipt Number: 22RP014152,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dontrell Trenton Heard-Handy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
